items.title: Inside the grooming process that made Epstein and Maxwell so dangerous
items.description: The arts camp was prestigious, and "Jane" had travelled almost 2,500 kilometres to attend. As she sat by herself on a bench between classes, a man and a woman approached her.

items.title: New Year's Eve celebrations to feature tribute to Bondi terror attack victims
items.description: Sydney's New Year's Eve celebrations will this year pay tribute to the victims of the Bondi terror attack, with events to feature a heavy police presence. Here is everything you need to know to plan your night.

items.title: Man charged with string of offences after burglaries on Christmas Day
items.description: A man is arrested following a Melbourne crime spree that allegedly began about 7pm on Christmas Day and ended with burglaries of two restaurants about 6:30am on Boxing Day.

items.title: Live: Australia trying to extend Boxing Day Test after 'carnage and chaos' at the MCG
items.description: Australia, featuring night watchman and local hero Scott Boland, is hoping to show some resilience with the bat on day two to drive home its advantage after a chaotic Boxing Day at the MCG. Follow live.

items.title: Master Lock Comanche keeps narrow lead in Sydney to Hobart race overnight
items.description: Master Lock Comanche has kept its narrow lead over long-time rival LawConnect in the Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race overnight as the two supermaxis race down Australia's east coast for day two of the blue water classic.

items.title: Parts of Queensland bracing for heavy rain and potential flooding
items.description: Holiday travellers are being urged to check road closures before setting off on their journey, with parts of the state expecting rain into the middle of next week.

items.title: Mother and stepson drift 10 kilometres in Christmas paddleboard mishap
items.description: Police say two holidaymakers are lucky to be alive after being rescued from the cold waters of Port Phillip, south-west of Melbourne, on Christmas Day.

items.title: When green energy threatens what it is meant to save
items.description: In a tiny town near the Victoria–South Australia border, a proposed wind farm near a protected wetland is posing a big question for Australia's planning regulators.

items.title: 'Voracious feeders' set loose at Parliament House to take out pests
items.description: When politicians and most staff are away for the summer holidays, a ravenous group of fly-in workers descend on Parliament House.

items.title: Somalia, Arab nations denounce Israeli recognition of Somaliland
items.description: Matters of strategy are behind Israel's drive to recognise Somaliland, analysts say, as Arab nations worry about instability in the region.

items.title: At least 14 injured in a knife and chemical attack at factory in Japan
items.description: A man has been arrested after stabbing eight people at a factory in the Japanese city of Mishima.

items.title: Mosque blast during Friday prayers kills eight in Syria
items.description: The attack has been claimed by the ultra-conservative Sunni group Saraya Ansar al-Sunnah, which was also responsible for a Damascus church bombing in June.

items.title: Myanmar's first election in five years begins – but experts warn it's a sham
items.description: Five years after the military toppled a democratically elected government and imprisoned its leaders, the country is preparing to hold national elections beginning on December 28.

items.title: Burnout, landlines and a lost trekker: 13 reads for a holiday weekend
items.description: Here we've gathered a bunch of other things to read while you're relaxing over summer.

items.title: ABC 50/50 quiz: Die Hard, pizza and princesses
items.description: Every question has only two options: one is right and the other is wrong. You have an even chance of guessing correctly each time.

items.title: The assassination of a leader returned from exile that shook Pakistan
items.description: During the tense campaign for her third term as prime minister of Pakistan, Benazir Bhutto survived one attempt on her life before she was shot dead by a teenage suicide bomber on December 27, 2007. She helped to build a political dynasty that continues.

items.title: Zelenskyy says he plans to meet with Trump on Sunday
items.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says he is planning to meet with US President Donald Trump on Sunday to search for ways to end the war with Russia.

items.title: Poland intercepts Russian plane, reports airspace breaches from Belarus
items.description: Poland has warned several incidents regarding airspace during the holiday season may signal a provocation.

items.title: Lucinda donated her heart to another woman 20 years ago. She's still alive to tell the tale
items.description: Lucinda is a member of an exclusive club — living heart donors, and is the only woman to have a baby after a heart-lung-liver transplant

items.title: Tim Wilson believes 'most' Liberal MPs would be untroubled by gay leader
items.description: In a broad ranging interview for the Politics Now podcast, Liberal MP Tim Wilson speaks about what the Liberal Party should be fighting for and why he would one day like to be its leader.

items.title: Historic riverside Nor' West Bend open to public after decades of restoration
items.description: History is being brought back to life at a former pastoral station that has seen drought, boom and bust over the course of its 175 years.

items.title: Boddington gold mine damaged in out-of-control bushfire
items.description: The bushfire remains uncontained and out of control, and has burnt through nearly 3,700 hectares.

items.title: NT government blocks release of gallery plan, tourism group bids for space
items.description: Plans for Darwin's new State Square Art Gallery remain unclear, with the Northern Territory arts minister saying he is "eagerly awaiting" an outcome of who will move into the $145 million building.

items.title: Family unearths story of Australian cricket's 'girl Bradman' Hazel Pritchard
items.description: There was no central catalogue for the scattered histories of women's cricket. That may be about to change.

items.title: Tim David injures hamstring as Hurricanes beat Scorchers
items.description: Hobart's title defence suffers a huge blow after star batter Tim David injures his hamstring in his team's four-wicket win over the Scorchers.
